posts.content:
Hello, I'm looking at re-covering my door cards... the cards are in pretty good nick at the moment and have a layer of foam/padding with a plain vinyl on the top.

As wandered around "The Range" looking for christmas tat, i found some PVC on a roll sold by the metre... i thought some of the designs looked quite cool and maybe would work as a covering for the door cards.

After a little bit of searching I found this stuff... http://www.tableclothshop.co.uk/shop/vinyl-tablecloths/

I'm just wondering if anyone has used PVC table cloth material as a door card covering before? if so was it any good?

I imagine it would be quite thin... but looking at the existing stuff on my cards... that's quite thin too... i'd just cover over the existing stuff... easy to clean too

Any tips/thoughts/ideas appreciated

hi there..
I haven't used this before but I suspect a few have...I was thinking similar because Cath Kidston does a lovely range of plastic coated coverings....I would say...if it works for you and its going to be practical ..just do it.....

maybe someone will reply something a bit more useful, but i can't see any reason why it wouln't work..maybe just a tad cold sleeping next to it

good luck with it anyway

Sarah
I did similar on my bay cards. Looks great. Go for it.
